TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: Wait! Wait! I mean they don't count toward post total, but the likes do count.

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> Wait! Wait! I mean they don't count toward post total, but the likes do count.
> 

So when people like my posts in The Lounge I get RP?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> So when people like my posts in The Lounge I get RP?
> 

Yes.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> Damnit! That's like 70% of my posts!
> 

Dollar. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif ":sticktongue:")

How long have the forums been around and whats this "Hype Train Bug"/2014 blah <font face="Lucida Sans Unicode, Lucida Grande, sans-serif">blah thing I keep hearing about where something happened and accounts got deleted or something or other?</font>

The forum was created in early 2012, and there was a time when the software had some kind of failure and they discovered that the most recent uncorrupted backup was from 7 months earlier, so post and rep counts were set back 7 months and all the new accounts created in that time we lost. 

Press F for my 40 lost rep points and roughly 1080 eradicated posts. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

[@The Minmus Derp](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/187595-the-minmus-derp/) It's not immediately obvious, so that's a very good question! But just imagine that you give someone a thumbs down, and the person gets offended by that so he goes through all of your posts in order to give you thumbs down everywhere he sees you have said something. Can you imagine what the forum would be like?
good point. Maybe you can do 1 per person per day!

> 19 hours ago, Mad Rocket Scientist said:
> 
> 
> I think it's only post count, since you both have < 1000 and > 500 posts. I'll make some notes and try figure it out on the weekend.

Just adding a data point for you here MRS.

Post count/dot relationship:

> 1499 = 5 dots.

> 499 = 4 dots

> 99 = 3 dots

> 4 = 2 dots

> -1 = 1 dot

There are only 297 members with 5 dots on the forums, but over 126 thousand members with only one dot. Also, you only have to go ~2600 pages in to a ~8000 page member list sorted by post count to reach the last person with just one post. I'm considering learning to use python to scrape post count and reputation to take a look at more of this stuff, but it'd take a while with the 1 search per 2 second limit.
